metadata.titel_preek: Battle: Lead Us and Deliver Us

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of a believer from spiritual 'slipping' (envy and despair) to spiritual stability through the encounter with God in the sanctuary (prayer/gospel).

subject.identificatie: The Believer / The Hearer (represented by the Psalmist)
tekstueel_bewijs: I have kept my heart pure
I tried to understand all this
I entered the sanctuary of God

object.identificatie: Spiritual stability and the 'portion' of God (Presence)
tekstueel_bewijs: God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever
afterward you will take me into glory

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of the Covenant/Gospel)
tekstueel_bewijs: Surely God is good to Israel
You guide me with your counsel
you hold me by my right hand
earth has nothing I desire besides you
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject who is failing and must become the Receiver of grace.

tekstueel_bewijs: till I entered the sanctuary of God
I am the temple... I am the final bloody sacrifice
helper.rol_van_god: God is both the Subject (holding the hand) and the Helper (the sacrifice).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the one reorienting the heart's desires.

tegenstander.identificatie: Envy, the prosperity of the wicked, and the 'beastly' self
tekstueel_bewijs: I was a brute beast before you
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just external circumstances but a 'slipping' of the soul that leads to spiritual destruction.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'In Vain' Program: Trying to live a good life to earn a good life.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Moralistic Self
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher exposes that the hearer often confuses the secondary program (ethics for payoff) with the primary program (grace).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Believer → Desire for God alone

voorbeelden_god_subject: you hold me by my right hand
you guide me with your counsel
Jesus got the punishment for you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I have kept my heart pure
we get into the Christian faith because...

voorbeelden: you need to take responsibility for
earth has nothing I desire besides you
we want these things more than I want you
then I understood their final destiny
I want to show you tonight...
God is the strength of my heart
only love of the immutable... will ever get you to the place

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Vouloir' (desire) of the heart. It diagnoses a disordered 'Vouloir' and proposes that only a 'Pouvoir' (power) from the Gospel can reorder it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Envy) through the illusion of ~S2 (Prosperity) to the threat of S2 (Ruin), finally resolving in S1 (Grace/Presence) via the Sanctuary.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ taking the 'S2' (punishment/forsakenness) so the Subject can move to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Ruin is described as 'spiritual destruction' and being 'swept away'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses many 'I' statements, it systematically deconstructs human effort ('in vain') and identifies God's action (holding the hand) as the only sustaining force.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I want to know whether you’re willing to be as honest as he is.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus got the punishment you deserve so that... he holds you by your right hand.
My goodness was really quite selfish and, therefore, wasn’t really goodness.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist is used as a model for prayer, but the preacher quickly shifts from 'be like him' to 'see what God did for him'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: God is the one holding the hand of the 'brute beast'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of performance; reorientation of desire toward God.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic comfort: God's grip is the cause of our standing.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'battle' of life to the 'sanctuary' of the gospel is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The call to 'admit the worst' can feel like a work of the self before grace is applied.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus was standing in our place and he was getting what we deserve.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly named, but the 'reordering of loves' implies an internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is described as being a 'brute beast' and 'using God' rather than loving Him.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God ('afterward you will take me into glory')

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully moves the hearer from the role of 'Subject of their own salvation' to 'Receiver of God's action'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'effort' of going to the sanctuary.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that God brings us to the sanctuary.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention the Holy Spirit as the one who enables the reordering of loves.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of deconstructing moralism to reveal the underlying actantial agency of God in the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'four points'; Greimas shows the underlying shift from 'Self-as-Subject' to 'God-as-Subject'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Psalm 73; Greimas shows how the sermon functions as a 'delivery system' for the actant of Grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'sanctuary' functions as a semiotic 'space of transformation' where actantial roles are swapped.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'brute beast' imagery to effectively lower the Subject's competence, necessitating a Divine Subject.
